deployedGeneratedSources.name: #utility.yul

params._usr: The address which will spend the funds.
params._wad: The amount of tokens to allow.

returns._0: A boolean value indicating whether the operation succeeded.

burn(address,uint256).details: This function can only be called by `_usr` or an approved address.

params._usr: The address to burn tokens from.
params._wad: The amount of tokens to burn.

params._usr: The address which will spend the funds.
params._wad: The amount of tokens to decrease the allowance by.

returns._0: A boolean value indicating whether the operation succeeded.

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event.

params._usr: The address which will spend the funds.
params._wad: The amount of tokens to increase the allowance by.

returns._0: A boolean value indicating whether the operation succeeded.

mint(address,uint256).details: This function can only be called by addresses with the minter role.

params._usr: The address to assign the new tokens to.
params._wad: The amount of new tokens to create.

params._dst: The address to transfer tokens to.
params._src: The address to transfer tokens from.
params._wad: The amount of tokens to transfer.

params._usr: The address to transfer tokens from.
params._wad: The amount of tokens to transfer.

params._usr: The address to transfer tokens to.
params._wad: The amount of tokens to transfer.

params._name: The new name of the token.

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `account`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

params._dst: The address to transfer tokens to.
params._wad: The amount of tokens to transfer.

returns._0: A boolean value indicating whether the operation succeeded.

params._dst: The address to transfer tokens to.
params._src: The address to transfer tokens from.
params._wad: The amount of tokens to transfer.

returns._0: A boolean value indicating whether the operation succeeded.

allowance.details: Returns the remaining number of tokens that `spender` will be allowed to spend on behalf of `owner` through {transferFrom}. This is zero by default. This value changes when {approve} or {transferFrom} are called.

balanceOf.details: Returns the amount of tokens owned by `account`.

totalSupply.details: Returns the amount of tokens in existence.

approve(address,uint256).notice: Set `_wad` as the allowance of `_usr` over the `msg.sender`'s tokens.

burn(address,uint256).notice: Destroys `_wad` amount tokens from `_usr`, reducing the total supply.

decreaseAllowance(address,uint256).notice: Decrease the allowance of `_usr` over the `msg.sender`'s tokens by `_wad`.

increaseAllowance(address,uint256).notice: Increase the allowance of `_usr` over the `msg.sender`'s tokens by `_wad`.

mint(address,uint256).notice: Creates `_wad` amount of new tokens and assigns them to `_usr`, increasing the total supply.

rename(string).notice: Change the name of the token to `_name`.

transfer(address,uint256).notice: Transfer `_wad` amount of tokens from `msg.sender` to `_dst`.

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).notice: Transfer `_wad` amount of tokens from `_src` to `_dst`.
